Title: A Confident Prayer for Refuge
Description: To the music director. A psalm of David.

Verses.1:
In You, LORD, I have taken refuge, [t]
	never let me be ashamed, [*]
	in Your righteousness, rescue me.
Verses.2:
Incline Your ear towards me, [*]
	and rescue me quickly.
Be my rock of strength, [*]
	a strong fortress to save me.
Verses.3:
Since You are my rock and fortress, [*]
	lead and guide me for the sake of Your name.
Verses.4:
Spare me from the trap they laid for me in secret, [*]
	for You are my protector.
Verses.5:
Into Your hands I entrust my spirit, [*]
	for You have redeemed me, LORD, God of truth.
Verses.6:
I hate those clinging to worthless idols, [*]
	for me, I trust in the LORD.
Verses.7:
In Your faithfulness, I will rejoice and be glad, [t]
	because You saw me afflicted. [*]
	You know the anguish of my soul.
Verses.8:
And You have not handed me over to my enemy, [*]
	but set my feet in a large place.
Verses.9:
Have mercy on me, LORD, for I am in distress, [t]
	my eye is wasting away in grief, [*]
	my soul and my body too.
Verses.10:
I spend my life consumed in sorrow, [*]
	and my years groaning.
My strength fails under my guilt, [*]
	and my bones are crumbling away.
Verses.11:
Due to my enemies, I have become despised, [t]
	an object of dread to my neighbors and friends, [*]
	those who see me on the street flee from me.
Verses.12:
I have been forgotten like the dead and cast out of mind, [*]
	I am like broken pottery.
Verses.13:
For I have heard many people's slander, and their terror surrounds me, [t]
	while they conspire against me, [*]
	and plot to take my life.
Verses.14:
But as for me, I trust in You, LORD! [t]
	I say, "You are my God! [*]
Verses.15:
My days are in Your hands."
Rescue me from the hands of my enemies, [*]
	and from those who pursue me.
Verses.16:
Shine Your face upon Your servant, [*]
	save me through Your unfailing love.
Verses.17:
Let me not be put to shame, LORD, for I call upon You, [*]
	but let the wicked be ashamed and fall quiet in Sheol.
Verses.18:
Put to silence their lying lips, [t]
	for the vile and contemptuous things they speak [*]
	in arrogance against the righteous.
Verses.19:
How great is Your goodness! [*]
	Which You stored up for those who fear You.
In the sight of everyone, You have acted [*]
	for those who take refuge in You.
Verses.20:
You shelter them in Your presence, [*]
	hiding them from all human conspiracies.
You keep them sheltered in secret, [*]
	safe from accusing tongues.
Verses.21:
Blessed is the LORD, [*]
	while in a city under siege, he showed me his marvelous faithfulness.
Verses.22:
In my alarm I said, [*]
	"I am cut off from Your eyes."
Yet You still heard my pleas [*]
	when I cried out to You for help.
Verses.23:
Love the LORD, all his holy people! [t]
	The LORD preserves the faithful, [*]
	but rewards the proud in full.
Verses.24:
Be strong and let your heart be courageous, [*]
	all you who wait for the LORD.
